laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild to moderate 68Ga-PSMA-ligand avidity in a solitary 7-mm right perihilar noncalcified node; uptake slightly less than background liver. CT scan demonstrated scattered bilateral micronodules (<5 mm), which were stable over several years. Transbronchial fine needle aspirate yielded findings of anthracosilicosis with macrophages in aggregates containing abundant anthracotic pigment and birefringent silica.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A follow-up PET/CT performed 3 months later showed a mild reduction in 68Ga-PSMA-ligand uptake within the morphologically stable node.
